comment.description: A descriptive comment of a DHCP relay agent filter object.

is_circuit_id_substring.description: Determines if the substring of circuit ID, instead of the full circuit ID, is matched.

is_remote_id_substring.description: Determines if the substring of remote ID, instead of the full remote ID, is matched.

circuit_id_name.description: The circuit_id_name of a DHCP relay agent filter object. This filter identifies the circuit between the remote host and the relay agent. For example, the identifier can be the ingress interface number of the circuit access unit, perhaps concatenated with the unit ID number and slot number. Also, the circuit ID can be an ATM virtual circuit ID or cable data virtual circuit ID.

is_remote_id.description: The remote ID matching rule of a DHCP relay agent filter object. The remote_id value takes effect only if the value is Matches_Value.

is_circuit_id.description: The circuit ID matching rule of a DHCP relay agent filter object. The circuit_id value takes effect only if the value is MATCHES_VALUE.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

remote_id_name.description: The remote ID name attribute of a relay agent filter object. This filter identifies the remote host. The remote ID name can represent many different things such as the caller ID telephone number for a dial-up connection, a user name for logging in to the ISP, a modem ID, etc. When the remote ID name is defined on the relay agent, the DHCP server will have a trusted relationship to identify the remote host. The remote ID name is considered as a trusted identifier.

name.description: The name of a DHCP relay agent filter object.

comment.description: Comment for the shared network, maximum 256 characters.

dhcp_utilization.description: The percentage of the total DHCP utilization of the networks belonging to the shared network multiplied by 1000. This is the percentage of the total number of available IP addresses from all the networks belonging to the shared network versus the total number of all IP addresses in all of the networks in the shared network.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a shared network object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ms_ad_user_data.description: The Microsoft Active Directory user related information.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: By default, the DHCP server does not update DNS when it allocates a fixed address to a client. You can configure the DHCP server to update the A and PTR records of a client with a fixed address. When this feature is enabled and the DHCP server adds A and PTR records for a fixed address, the DHCP server never discards the records.

networks.description: A list of networks belonging to the shared network Each individual list item must be specified as an object containing a '_ref' parameter to a network reference, for example:: [{ _ref: network/ZG5zLm5ldHdvcmskMTAuMwLvMTYvMA, }] if the reference of the wanted network is not known, it is possible to specify search parameters for the network instead in the following way:: [{ _ref: { 'network': '10.0.0.0/8', } }] note that in this case the search must match exactly one network for the assignment to be successful.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the this shared network. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

dynamic_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP leases issued for the shared network.

bootfile.description: The bootfile name for the shared network. You can configure the DHCP server to support clients that use the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ignore_client_identifier.description: If set to true, the client identifier will be ignored.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP clients requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_use_option81 is True.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses. Valid values are NONE, CLIENT, or MACADDR. The default is NONE.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address of the next server that the host needs to boot.

static_hosts.description: The number of static DHCP addresses configured in the shared network.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a shared network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a shared network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

deny_bootp.description: If set to true, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

dhcp_utilization_status.description: A string describing the utilization level of the shared network.

ddns_use_option81.description: The support for DHCP Option 81 at the shared network level.

You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

For searching by this field, use an HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with MS DHCP server structure msdhcpserver and the request should have option _method=GET.

CIRCUIT_ID: The fixed IP address is leased to the DHCP client with a matching circuit ID. Note that the agent_circuit_id field must be set in this case. REMOTE_ID: The fixed IP address is leased to the DHCP client with a matching remote ID. Note that the agent_remote_id field must be set in this case.

unmanaged_count.description: The number of unmanaged IP addresses as discovered by network discovery.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP clients requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_use_option81 is True.

deny_bootp.description: If set to true, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

high_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage below which the corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization assoicated with the network container.

unmanaged.description: Determines whether the network container is unmanaged or not.

discovery_blackout_setting.description: The discovery blackout setting for this network container.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a DHCP Network container object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network container object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ipam_trap_settings.description: The IPAM Trap settings for this network container.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

high_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage threshold above which network container usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

port_control_blackout_setting.description: The port control blackout setting for this network container.

low_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage threshold below which network container usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the low watermark is crossed, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

delete_reason.description: The reason for deleting the RIR registration request.

ddns_use_option81.description: The support for DHCP Option 81 at the network container level.

network.description: The network address in IPv4 Address/CIDR format. For regular expression searches, only the IPv4 Address portion is supported. Searches for the CIDR portion is always an exact match. For example, both network containers 10.0.0.0/8 and 20.1.0.0/16 are matched by expression '.0' and only 20.1.0.0/16 is matched by '.0/16'.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on the this network container. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP network container usage below which the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

discovery_basic_poll_settings.description: The discovery basic poll settings for this network.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

subscribe_settings.description: The DHCP Network Container Cisco ISE subscribe settings.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: By default, the DHCP server does not update DNS when it allocates a fixed address to a client. You can configure the DHCP server to update the A and PTR records of a client with a fixed address. When this feature is enabled and the DHCP server adds A and PTR records for a fixed address, the DHCP server never discards the records.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

ddns_domainname.description: The member DDNS domain name value.

ddns_zone_primaries.description: An ordered list of zone primaries that will receive DDNS updates.

authn_server_group_enabled.description: The flag that controls if this DHCP member can send authentication requests to an authentication server group.

ipv6_recycle_leases.description: Determines if the IPv6 recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If the feature is enabled, leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after lease expiration. When the feature is disabled, the leases are irrecoverably deleted.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if SNMP warnings are enabled or disabled on this DHCP member. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an SNMP trap to the trap receiver that was defined for the Grid member level.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

option60_match_rules.description: The list of option 60 match rules.

dhcp_utilization.description: The percentage of the total DHCP utilization of DHCP objects belonging to the Grid Member multiplied by 1000. This is the percentage of the total number of available IP addresses from all the DHCP objects belonging to the Grid Member versus the total number of all IP addresses in all of the DHCP objects on the Grid Member.

lease_scavenge_time.description: Determines the lease scavenging time value. When this field is set, the appliance permanently deletes the free and backup leases that remain in the database beyond a specified period of time. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

ipv6_lease_scavenging_time.description: The member-level grace period (in seconds) to keep an expired lease before it is deleted by the scavenging process.

ddns_update_fixed_addresses.description: Determines if the member DHCP server's ability to update the A and PTR records with a fixed address is enabled or not.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: Determines the ability of a member DHCP server to generate a host name and update DNS with this host name when it receives a DHCP REQUEST message that does not include a host name.

enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the appliance is enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCP clients.

microsoft_code_page.description: The Microsoft client DHCP IPv4 code page value of a grid member. This value is the hostname translation code page for Microsoft DHCP IPv4 clients and overrides the Grid level Microsoft DHCP IPv4 client code page.

dynamic_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP leases issued for the DHCP objects on the Grid Member.

enable_hostname_rewrite.description: Determines if the Grid member's host name rewrite feature is enabled or not.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines that only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the requests from the DHCP clients. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ipv6_ddns_domainname.description: The member DDNS IPv6 domain name value.

enable_ddns.description: Determines if the member DHCP server's ability to send DDNS updates is enabled or not.

ipv6_enable_retry_updates.description: Determines if the DHCPv6 server retries failed dynamic DNS updates or not.

ipv4addr.description: The IPv4 Address of the Grid member.

total_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP addresses configured in DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

valid_lifetime.description: The valid lifetime for Grid Member DHCP. Specifies the length of time addresses that are assigned to DHCPv6 clients remain in the valid state.

ipv6addr.description: The IPv6 Address of the Grid member.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: Determines if the ignore DHCP option list request flag of a Grid member DHCP is enabled or not. If this flag is set to true all available DHCP options will be returned to the client.

lease_per_client_settings.description: Defines how the appliance releases DHCP leases. Valid values are RELEASE_MACHING_ID, NEVER_RELEASE, or ONE_LEASE_PER_CLIENT. The default is RELEASE_MATCHING_ID.

enable_dhcp_on_lan2.description: Determines if the DHCP service on the LAN2 interface is enabled or not.

prefix_length_mode.description: The Prefix length mode for DHCPv6.

ipv6_enable_ddns.description: Determines if sending DDNS updates by the member DHCPv6 server is enabled or not.

ipv6_enable_gss_tsig.description: Determines whether the appliance is enabled to receive GSS-TSIG authenticated updates from DHCPv6 clients.

enable_dhcp_on_ipv6_lan2.description: Determines if the DHCP service on the IPv6 LAN2 interface is enabled or not.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if e-mail warnings are enabled or disabled. When DHCP threshold is enabled and DHCP address usage crosses a watermark threshold, the appliance sends an e-mail notification to an administrator.

ipv6_server_duid.description: The server DHCPv6 unique identifier (DUID) for the Grid member.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

retry_ddns_updates.description: Indicates whether the DHCP server makes repeated attempts to send DDNS updates to a DNS server.

use_ipv6_lease_scavenging.description: Use flag for: ipv6_enable_lease_scavenging , ipv6_lease_scavenging_time, ipv6_remember_expired_client_association

gss_tsig_keys.description: The list of GSS-TSIG keys for a member DHCP object.

ipv6_ddns_server_always_updates.description: Determines if the server always updates DNS or updates only if requested by the client.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Represents the watermarks above or below which address usage in a network is unexpected and might warrant your attention. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

ddns_ttl.description: The DDNS TTL (Dynamic DNS Time To Live) value specifies the number of seconds an IP address for the name is cached.

bootfile.description: The name of a file that DHCP clients need to boot. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

static_hosts.description: The number of static DHCP addresses configured in DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

dhcp_utilization_status.description: A string describing the utilization level of DHCP objects that belong to the Grid Member.

email_list.description: The email_list value of a member DHCP server.

ipv6_update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: Controls whether the DHCPv6 server updates DNS when an IPv6 DHCP lease is renewed.

recycle_leases.description: Determines if the recycle leases feature is enabled or not. If you enabled this feature and then delete a DHCP range, the appliance stores active leases from this range up to one week after the leases expires.

bootserver.description: The name of the server on which a boot file is stored. This setting overrides the Grid level setting.

comment.description: A descriptive comment of a range template object.

fingerprint_filter_rules.description: This field contains the fingerprint filters for this DHCP range. The appliance uses matching rules in these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

number_of_addresses.description: The number of addresses for this range.

high_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage below which the corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

cloud_api_compatible.description: This flag controls whether this template can be used to create network objects in a cloud-computing deployment.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are sent through email.

exclude.description: These are ranges of IP addresses that the appliance does not use to assign to clients. You can use these exclusion addresses as static IP addresses. They contain the start and end addresses of the exclusion range, and optionally, information about this exclusion range.

unknown_clients.description: Permission for unknown clients. If set to 'Deny' unknown clients will be denied IP addresses. Known clients include roaming hosts and clients with fixed addresses or DHCP host entries. Unknown clients include clients that are not roaming hosts and clients that do not have fixed addresses or DHCP host entries.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value for a range object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ms_server.description: The Microsoft server that will provide service for this range. {rangetemplate:rangetemplate} needs to be set to 'MS_SERVER' if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with MS DHCP server structure msdhcpserver and the request should have option _method=GET.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are sent through SNMP.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied on this range. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

deny_all_clients.description: If True, send NAK forcing the client to take the new address.

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Determines if DHCP thresholds are enabled for the range.

member.description: The member that will provide service for this range. {rangetemplate:rangetemplate} needs to be set to 'MEMBER' if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with Dhcp Member structure dhcpmember and the request should have option _method=GET.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

bootfile.description: The bootfile name for the range. You can configure the DHCP server to support clients that use the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

low_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage below which the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address format of the next server that the host needs to boot.

known_clients.description: Permission for known clients. If set to 'Deny' known clients will be denied IP addresses. Known clients include roaming hosts and clients with fixed addresses or DHCP host entries. Unknown clients include clients that are not roaming hosts and clients that do not have fixed addresses or DHCP host entries.

nac_filter_rules.description: This field contains the NAC filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

option_filter_rules.description: This field contains the Option filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

server_association_type.description: The type of server that is going to serve the range.

delegated_member.description: The vconnector member that the object should be delegated to when created from this range template.

mac_filter_rules.description: This field contains the MAC filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

enable_ddns.description: Determines if the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

offset.description: The start address offset for this range.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this range.

high_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage threshold above which range usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

name.description: The name of a range template object.

deny_bootp.description: Determines if BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

failover_association.description: The name of the failover association: the server in this failover association will serve the IPv4 range in case the main server is out of service. {rangetemplate:rangetemplate} must be set to 'FAILOVER' or 'FAILOVER_MS' if you want the failover association specified here to serve the range.

ms_options.description: The Microsoft DHCP options for this range.

low_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage threshold below which range usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the low watermark is crossed, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

relay_agent_filter_rules.description: This field contains the Relay Agent filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

bootserver.description: The bootserver address for the range. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

comment.description: Comment for the network; maximum 256 characters.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization associated with the IPv6 network.

ipv6prefix.description: The IPv6 Address prefix of the DHCP IPv6 network.

cloud_api_compatible.description: This flag controls whether this template can be used to create network objects in a cloud-computing deployment.

rir.description: The registry (RIR) that allocated the IPv6 network address space.

rir_registration_status.description: The registration status of the IPv6 network in RIR.

auto_create_reversezone.description: This flag controls whether reverse zones are automatically created when the network is added.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

rir_registration_action.description: The action for the RIR registration.

domain_name_servers.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. The DHCP server can send DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid and to external DNS servers. This setting overrides the member level settings.

domain_name.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the domain_name value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this network.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

fixed_address_templates.description: The list of IPv6 fixed address templates assigned to this IPv6 network template object. When you create an IPv6 network based on an IPv6 network template object that contains IPv6 fixed address templates, the IPv6 fixed addresses are created based on the associated IPv6 fixed address templates.

delegated_member.description: Reference the Cloud Platform Appliance to which authority of the object should be delegated when the object is created using the template.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP IPv6 network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

range_templates.description: The list of IPv6 address range templates assigned to this IPv6 network template object. When you create an IPv6 network based on an IPv6 network template object that contains IPv6 range templates, the IPv6 address ranges are created based on the associated IPv6 address range templates.

allow_any_netmask.description: This flag controls whether the template allows any netmask. You must specify a netmask when creating a network using this template. If you set this parameter to False, you must specify the cidr field for the network template object.

send_rir_request.description: Determines whether to send the RIR registration request.

members.description: A list of members that serve DHCP for the network. All members in the array must be of the same type. The struct type must be indicated in each element, by setting the _struct member to the struct type.

cidr.description: The CIDR of the network in CIDR format.

ddns_server_always_updates.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP client requests. Note that changes for this field take effect only if ddns_enable_option_fqdn is True.

name.description: The name of this IPv6 network template.

preferred_lifetime.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the preferred lifetime value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

valid_lifetime.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the valid lifetime value of a DHCP IPv6 Network object.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

ddns_enable_option_fqdn.description: Use this method to set or retrieve the ddns_enable_option_fqdn flag of a DHCP IPv6 Network object. This method controls whether the FQDN option sent by the client is to be used, or if the server can automatically generate the FQDN. This setting overrides the upper-level settings.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

comment.description: Comment for the range; maximum 256 characters.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this range.

end_addr.description: The IPv6 Address end address of the DHCP IPv6 range.

exclude.description: These are ranges of IP addresses that the appliance does not use to assign to clients. You can use these exclusion addresses as static IP addresses. They contain the start and end addresses of the exclusion range, and optionally,information about this exclusion range.

same_port_control_discovery_blackout.description: If the field is set to True, the discovery blackout setting will be used for port control blackout setting.

enable_immediate_discovery.description: Determines if the discovery for the range should be immediately enabled.

endpoint_sources.description: The endpoints that provides data for the DHCP IPv6 Range object.

network.description: The network this range belongs to, in IPv6 Address/CIDR format.

start_addr.description: The IPv6 Address starting address of the DHCP IPv6 range.

subscribe_settings.description: The DHCP IPv6 Range Cisco ISE subscribe settings.

member.description: The member that will provide service for this range. {ipv6range:ipv6range} needs to be set to 'MEMBER' if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with Dhcp Member structure dhcpmember and the request should have option _method=GET.

discovery_blackout_setting.description: The discovery blackout setting for this range.

template.description: If set on creation, the range will be created according to the values specified in the named template.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

address_type.description: Type of a DHCP IPv6 Range object. Valid values are ADDRESS, PREFIX, or BOTH. When the address type is ADDRESS, values for the 'start_addr' and 'end_addr' members are required. When the address type is PREFIX, values for 'ipv6_start_prefix', 'ipv6_end_prefix', and 'ipv6_prefix_bits' are required. When the address type is BOTH, values for 'start_addr', 'end_addr', 'ipv6_start_prefix', 'ipv6_end_prefix', and 'ipv6_prefix_bits' are all required.

server_association_type.description: The type of server that is going to serve the range. Valid values are: * MEMBER * NONE

ipv6_end_prefix.description: The IPv6 Address end prefix of the DHCP IPv6 range.

discovery_basic_poll_settings.description: The discovery basic poll settings for this network.

disable.description: Determines whether a range is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the range is enabled.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

ipv6_start_prefix.description: The IPv6 Address starting prefix of the DHCP IPv6 range.

name.description: This field contains the name of the Microsoft scope.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this range resides.

discovery_member.description: The member that will run discovery for this range.

port_control_blackout_setting.description: The port control blackout setting for this range.

use_blackout_setting.description: Use flag for: discovery_blackout_setting , port_control_blackout_setting, same_port_control_discovery_blackout

ipv6_prefix_bits.description: Prefix bits of the DHCP IPv6 range.

enable_discovery.description: Determines whether a discovery is enabled or not for this range. When this is set to False, the discovery for this range is disabled.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

comment.description: The descriptive comment of a DHCP MAC Filter object.

lease_time.description: The length of time the DHCP server leases an IP address to a client. The lease time applies to hosts that meet the filter criteria.

name.description: The name of a DHCP MAC Filter object.

never_expires.description: Determines if DHCP MAC Filter never expires or automatically expires.

disable.description: Determines if the DHCP Fingerprint object is disabled or not.

enforce_expiration_times.description: The flag to enforce MAC address expiration of the DHCP MAC Address Filter object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

default_mac_address_expiration.description: The default MAC expiration time of the DHCP MAC Address Filter object. By default, the MAC address filter never expires; otherwise, it is the absolute interval when the MAC address filter expires. The maximum value can extend up to 4294967295 secs. The minimum value is 60 secs (1 min).

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

reserved_for_infoblox.description: This is reserved for writing comments related to the particular MAC address filter. The length of comment cannot exceed 1024 bytes.

code.description: The code of a DHCP option definition object. An option code number is used to identify the DHCP option.

type.description: The data type of the Grid DHCP option.

name.description: The name of a DHCP option definition object.

space.description: The space of a DHCP option definition object.

comment.description: A descriptive comment about a DHCP failover object.

max_unacked_updates.description: The maximum number of unacked updates value of a DHCP failover object. Specify the value of the maximum number of unacked updates in a 32-bit integer format (range from 0 to 4294967295) that represents the number of messages. Valid values are between 1 and 4294967295.

load_balance_split.description: A load balancing split value of a DHCP failover object. Specify the value of the maximum load balancing delay in a 8-bit integer format (range from 0 to 256).

ms_switchover_interval.description: The time (in seconds) that DHCPv4 server will wait before transitioning the server from the COMMUNICATION-INT state to PARTNER-DOWN state.

association_type.description: The value indicating whether the failover assoctaion is Microsoft or Grid based. This is a read-only attribute.

ms_shared_secret.description: The failover association authentication. This is a write-only attribute.

ms_failover_mode.description: The mode for the failover association.

ms_is_conflict.description: Determines if the matching Microsfot failover association (if any) is in synchronization (False) or not (True). If there is no matching failover association the returned values is False. This is a read-only attribute.

ms_enable_authentication.description: Determines if the authentication for the failover association is enabled or not.

max_client_lead_time.description: The maximum client lead time value of a DHCP failover object. Specify the value of the maximum client lead time in a 32-bit integer format (range from 0 to 4294967295) that represents the duration in seconds. Valid values are between 1 and 4294967295.

ms_enable_switchover_interval.description: Determines if the switchover interval is enabled or not.

max_load_balance_delay.description: The maximum load balancing delay value of a DHCP failover object. Specify the value of the maximum load balancing delay in a 32-bit integer format (range from 0 to 4294967295) that represents the duration in seconds. Valid values are between 1 and 4294967295.

failover_port.description: Determines the TCP port on which the server should listen for connections from its failover peer. Valid values are between 1 and 63999.

primary_server_type.description: The type of the primary server of DHCP Failover association object.

ms_association_mode.description: The value that indicates whether the failover association is read-write or read-only. This is a read-only attribute.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

ms_failover_partner.description: Failover partner defined in the association with the Microsoft Server.

secondary_server_type.description: The type of the secondary server of DHCP Failover association object.

ms_state.description: The failover association state. This is a read-only attribute.

secondary_state.description: The secondary server status of a DHCP failover object.

primary.description: The primary server of a DHCP failover object.

secondary.description: The secondary server of a DHCP failover object.

ms_hotstandby_partner_role.description: The partner role in the case of HotStandby.

max_response_delay.description: The maximum response delay value of a DHCP failover object. Specify the value of the maximum response delay in a 32-bit integer format (range from 0 to 4294967295) that represents the duration in seconds. Valid values are between 1 and 4294967295.

name.description: The name of a DHCP failover object.

primary_state.description: The primary server status of a DHCP failover object.

ms_previous_state.description: The previous failover association state. This is a read-only attribute.

recycle_leases.description: Determines if the leases are kept in recycle bin until one week after expiration or not.

comment.description: The descriptive comment of a DHCP NAC Filter object.

lease_time.description: The length of time the DHCP server leases an IP address to a client. The lease time applies to hosts that meet the filter criteria.

name.description: The name of a DHCP NAC Filter object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

expression.description: The conditional expression of a DHCP NAC Filter object.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

comment.description: A descriptive comment of a DHCP IPv6 option space object.

option_definitions.description: The list of DHCP IPv6 option definition objects.

enterprise_number.description: The enterprise number of a DHCP IPv6 option space object.

name.description: The name of a DHCP IPv6 option space object.

comment.description: Comment for the MAC filter address; maximum 256 characters.

never_expires.description: Determines if MAC address expiration is enabled or disabled.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

is_registered_user.description: Determines if the user has been authenticated or not.

filter.description: Name of the MAC filter to which this address belongs.

expiration_time.description: The absolute UNIX time (in seconds) until the address expires.

authentication_time.description: The absolute UNIX time (in seconds) since the address was last authenticated.

comment.description: A descriptive comment of an IPv6 fixed address template object.

name.description: Name of an IPv6 fixed address template object.

valid_lifetime.description: The valid lifetime value for this DHCP IPv6 fixed address template object.

number_of_addresses.description: The number of IPv6 addresses for this fixed address.

domain_name_servers.description: The IPv6 addresses of DNS recursive name servers to which the DHCP client can send name resolution requests. The DHCP server includes this information in the DNS Recursive Name Server option in Advertise, Rebind, Information-Request, and Reply messages.

domain_name.description: Domain name of the IPv6 fixed address template object.

offset.description: The start address offset for this IPv6 fixed address.

preferred_lifetime.description: The preferred lifetime value for this DHCP IPv6 fixed address template object.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

comment.description: Comment for the roaming host; maximum 256 characters.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value for this roaming host object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ipv6_enable_ddns.description: Set this to True to enable IPv6 DDNS.

ipv6_domain_name.description: The IPv6 domain name for this roaming host.

ipv6_force_roaming_hostname.description: Set this to True to use the roaming host name as its ddns_hostname.

dhcp_client_identifier.description: The DHCP client ID for the roaming host.

ipv6_client_hostname.description: The client hostname of a DHCP roaming host object. This field specifies the host name that the DHCP client sends to the Infoblox appliance using DHCP option 12.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

bootfile.description: The bootfile name for the roaming host. You can configure the DHCP server to support clients that use the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

template.description: If set on creation, the roaming host will be created according to the values specified in the named template.

ipv6_ddns_domainname.description: The IPv6 DDNS domain name for this roaming host.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address format of the next server that the host needs to boot.

ddns_hostname.description: The DDNS host name for this roaming host.

address_type.description: The address type for this roaming host.

ipv6_template.description: If set on creation, the roaming host will be created according to the values specified in the named IPv6 roaming host template.

ipv6_options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of the roaming host object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

client_identifier_prepend_zero.description: This field controls whether there is a prepend for the dhcp-client-identifier of a roaming host.

deny_bootp.description: If set to true, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

mac.description: The MAC address for this roaming host.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

ipv6_ddns_hostname.description: The IPv6 DDNS host name for this roaming host.

ddns_domainname.description: The DDNS domain name for this roaming host.

match_client.description: The match-client value for this roaming host. Valid values are: MAC_ADDRESS: The fixed IP address is leased to the matching MAC address. CLIENT_ID: The fixed IP address is leased to the matching DHCP client identifier.

name.description: The name of this roaming host.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this roaming host resides.

ipv6_domain_name_servers.description: The IPv6 addresses of DNS recursive name servers to which the DHCP client can send name resolution requests. The DHCP server includes this information in the DNS Recursive Name Server option in Advertise, Rebind, Information-Request, and Reply messages.

preferred_lifetime.description: The preferred lifetime value for this roaming host object.

force_roaming_hostname.description: Set this to True to use the roaming host name as its ddns_hostname.

disable.description: Determines whether a roaming host is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the roaming host is enabled.

valid_lifetime.description: The valid lifetime value for this roaming host object.

ipv6_match_option.description: The identification method for an IPv6 or mixed IPv4/IPv6 roaming host. Currently, the only supported value for this field is DUID, which corresponds to identification by DHCPv6 unique ID.

ipv6_duid.description: The DUID value for this roaming host.

bootserver.description: The boot server address for the roaming host. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all the DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

fingerprint_filter_rules.description: This field contains the fingerprint filters for this DHCP range. The appliance uses matching rules in these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

high_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage below which the corresponding SNMP trap is reset. A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The high watermark reset value must be lower than the high watermark value.

discovery_blackout_setting.description: The discovery blackout setting for this range.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a DHCP Range object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

known_clients.description: Permission for known clients. This can be 'Allow' or 'Deny'. If set to 'Deny' known clients will be denied IP addresses. Known clients include roaming hosts and clients with fixed addresses or DHCP host entries. Unknown clients include clients that are not roaming hosts and clients that do not have fixed addresses or DHCP host entries.

mac_filter_rules.description: This field contains the MAC filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

deny_bootp.description: If set to true, BOOTP settings are disabled and BOOTP requests will be denied.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.

cloud_info.description: Structure containing all cloud API related information for this object.

high_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage threshold above which range usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

name.description: This field contains the name of the Microsoft scope.

port_control_blackout_setting.description: The port control blackout setting for this range.

use_blackout_setting.description: Use flag for: discovery_blackout_setting , port_control_blackout_setting, same_port_control_discovery_blackout

low_water_mark_reset.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage threshold below which range usage is not expected and may warrant your attention. When the low watermark is crossed, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100. The low watermark reset value must be higher than the low watermark value.

relay_agent_filter_rules.description: This field contains the Relay Agent filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

discover_now_status.description: Discover now status for this range.

end_addr.description: The IPv4 Address end address of the range.

enable_email_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are sent through email.

unknown_clients.description: Permission for unknown clients. This can be 'Allow' or 'Deny'. If set to 'Deny', unknown clients will be denied IP addresses. Known clients include roaming hosts and clients with fixed addresses or DHCP host entries. Unknown clients include clients that are not roaming hosts and clients that do not have fixed addresses or DHCP host entries.

network.description: The network to which this range belongs, in IPv4 Address/CIDR format.

logic_filter_rules.description: This field contains the logic filters to be applied to this range. This list corresponds to the match rules that are written to the dhcpd configuration file.

low_water_mark.description: The percentage of DHCP range usage below which the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

template.description: If set on creation, the range will be created according to the values specified in the named template.

ignore_id.description: Indicates whether the appliance will ignore DHCP client IDs or MAC addresses. Valid values are NONE, CLIENT, or MACADDR. The default is NONE.

nextserver.description: The name in FQDN and/or IPv4 Address of the next server that the host needs to boot.

nac_filter_rules.description: This field contains the NAC filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

option_filter_rules.description: This field contains the Option filters to be applied to this range. The appliance uses the matching rules of these filters to select the address range from which it assigns a lease.

enable_ifmap_publishing.description: Determines if IFMAP publishing is enabled for the range.

always_update_dns.description: This field controls whether only the DHCP server is allowed to update DNS, regardless of the DHCP clients requests.

lease_scavenge_time.description: An integer that specifies the period of time (in seconds) that frees and backs up leases remained in the database before they are automatically deleted. To disable lease scavenging, set the parameter to -1. The minimum positive value must be greater than 86400 seconds (1 day).

is_split_scope.description: This field will be 'true' if this particular range is part of a split scope.

network_view.description: The name of the network view in which this range resides.

start_addr.description: The IPv4 Address starting address of the range.

enable_discovery.description: Determines whether a discovery is enabled or not for this range. When this is set to False, the discovery for this range is disabled.

dynamic_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP leases issued for the range.

comment.description: Comment for the range; maximum 256 characters.

dhcp_utilization.description: The percentage of the total DHCP utilization of the range multiplied by 1000. This is the percentage of the total number of available IP addresses belonging to the range versus the total number of all IP addresses in the range.

same_port_control_discovery_blackout.description: If the field is set to True, the discovery blackout setting will be used for port control blackout setting.

enable_immediate_discovery.description: Determines if the discovery for the range should be immediately enabled.

endpoint_sources.description: The endpoints that provides data for the DHCP Range object.

enable_snmp_warnings.description: Determines if DHCP threshold warnings are send through SNMP.

subscribe_settings.description: The DHCP Range Cisco ISE subscribe settings.

deny_all_clients.description: If True, send NAK forcing the client to take the new address.

ddns_generate_hostname.description: If this field is set to True, the DHCP server generates a hostname and updates DNS with it when the DHCP client request does not contain a hostname.

ddns_domainname.description: The dynamic DNS domain name the appliance uses specifically for DDNS updates for this range.

server_association_type.description: The type of server that is going to serve the range.

discovery_member.description: The member that will run discovery for this range.

failover_association.description: The name of the failover association: the server in this failover association will serve the IPv4 range in case the main server is out of service. {range:range} must be set to 'FAILOVER' or 'FAILOVER_MS' if you want the failover association specified here to serve the range.

total_hosts.description: The total number of DHCP addresses configured in the range.

ignore_dhcp_option_list_request.description: If this field is set to False, the appliance returns all DHCP options the client is eligible to receive, rather than only the list of options the client has requested.

split_scope_exclusion_percent.description: This field controls the percentage used when creating a split scope. Valid values are numbers between 1 and 99. If the value is 40, it means that the top 40% of the exclusion will be created on the DHCP range assigned to {next_available_ip:next_available_ip} and the lower 60% of the range will be assigned to DHCP range assigned to {next_available_ip:next_available_ip}

ms_ad_user_data.description: The Microsoft Active Directory user related information.

exclude.description: These are ranges of IP addresses that the appliance does not use to assign to clients. You can use these exclusion addresses as static IP addresses. They contain the start and end addresses of the exclusion range, and optionally, information about this exclusion range.

update_dns_on_lease_renewal.description: This field controls whether the DHCP server updates DNS when a DHCP lease is renewed.

ms_server.description: The Microsoft server that will provide service for this range. {range:range} needs to be set to 'MS_SERVER' if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with MS DHCP server structure msdhcpserver and the request should have option _method=GET.

split_member.description: The Microsoft member to which the split scope is assigned. See {next_available_ip:next_available_ip} for more information

enable_dhcp_thresholds.description: Determines if DHCP thresholds are enabled for the range.

member.description: The member that will provide service for this range. {range:range} needs to be set to 'MEMBER' if you want the server specified here to serve the range. For searching by this field you should use a HTTP method that contains a body (POST or PUT) with Dhcp Member structure dhcpmember and the request should have option _method=GET.

bootfile.description: The bootfile name for the range. You can configure the DHCP server to support clients that use the boot file name option in their DHCPREQUEST messages.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP range object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

static_hosts.description: The number of static DHCP addresses configured in the range.

discovery_basic_poll_settings.description: The discovery basic poll settings for this network.

ignore_mac_addresses.description: A list of MAC addresses the appliance will ignore.

disable.description: Determines whether a range is disabled or not. When this is set to False, the range is enabled.

dhcp_utilization_status.description: A string describing the utilization level of the range.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

options.description: An array of DHCP option dhcpoption structs that lists the DHCP options associated with the object.

ms_options.description: This field contains the Microsoft DHCP options for this range.

recycle_leases.description: If the field is set to True, the leases are kept in the Recycle Bin until one week after expiration. Otherwise, the leases are permanently deleted.

bootserver.description: The bootserver address for the range. You can specify the name and/or IP address of the boot server that the host needs to boot. The boot server IPv4 Address or name in FQDN format.

remote_reverse_zones.description: The list of reverse-mapping zones to which the DHCP server sends the updates.

ddns_zone_primaries.description: An array of Ddns Zone Primary dhcpddns structs that lists the information of primary zone to wich DDNS updates should be sent.

mgm_private.description: This field controls whether this object is synchronized with the Multi-Grid Master. If this field is set to True, objects are not synchronized.

associated_dns_views.description: The list of DNS views associated with this network view.

is_default.description: The NIOS appliance provides one default network view. You can rename the default view and change its settings, but you cannot delete it. There must always be at least one network view in the appliance.

ms_ad_user_data.description: The Microsoft Active Directory user related information.

extattrs.description: Extensible attributes associated with the object. For valid values for extensible attributes, see {extattrs:values}.

remote_forward_zones.description: The list of forward-mapping zones to which the DHCP server sends the updates.

ddns_dns_view.description: DNS views that will receive the updates if you enable the appliance to send updates to Grid members.

comment.description: Comment for the network; maximum 256 characters.

rir_organization.description: The RIR organization assoicated with the network.

members.description: A list of members or Microsoft (r) servers that serve DHCP for this network. All members in the array must be of the same type. The struct type must be indicated in each element, by setting the _struct member to the struct type.

pxe_lease_time.description: The PXE lease time value of a DHCP Network object. Some hosts use PXE (Preboot Execution Environment) to boot remotely from a server. To better manage your IP resources, set a different lease time for PXE boot requests. You can configure the DHCP server to allocate an IP address with a shorter lease time to hosts that send PXE boot requests, so IP addresses are not leased longer than necessary. A 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

You can configure the DHCP server to update the A and PTR records of a client with a fixed address. When this feature is enabled and the DHCP server adds A and PTR records for a fixed address, the DHCP server never discards the records.

When the high watermark is reached, the Infoblox appliance generates a syslog message and sends a warning (if enabled). A number that specifies the percentage of allocated addresses. The range is from 1 to 100.

ddns_ttl.description: The DNS update Time to Live (TTL) value of a DHCP network object. The TTL is a 32-bit unsigned integer that represents the duration, in seconds, for which the update is cached. Zero indicates that the update is not cached.

ipam_trap_settings.description: The IPAM Trap settings for this network template.

enable_ddns.description: The dynamic DNS updates flag of a DHCP network object. If set to True, the DHCP server sends DDNS updates to DNS servers in the same Grid, and to external DNS servers.

range_templates.description: The list of IP address range templates assigned to this network template object. When you create a network based on a network template object that contains range templates, the IP address ranges are created based on the associated IP address range templates.

allow_any_netmask.description: This flag controls whether the template allows any netmask. You must specify a netmask when creating a network using this template. If you set this parameter to false, you must specify the netmask field for the network template object.

email_list.description: The e-mail lists to which the appliance sends DHCP threshold alarm e-mail messages.

netmask.description: The netmask of the network in CIDR format.

enable_pxe_lease_time.description: Set this to True if you want the DHCP server to use a different lease time for PXE clients.
